TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content:
And 0.13.3 completed. Fuel lines and being able to control the ship from the map screen make it so much better.

<iframe class="imgur-album" width="100%" height="550" frameborder="0" src="http://imgur.com/a/vfSAW/embed"></iframe>

Oh, this picture brings back memories

I lost Bill and Jeb. ;_;

FAR reentry is so much different from stock reentry.
Well, I do what kerbals do best! Die! I decided it would be fun to crash a spacecraft into a black hole.

Flew the Auk VIII up to Typhon 2, what its intended destination was supposed to be last night. Had a beautiful docking, resource transfer, rendezvous and landing on the KSC runway. I went ahead and pulled the plane off onto the taxiway so that I could call up the tow cart. Evidently the engineers in the SPH were drunk the day they put together this particular tow cart; the design was fine last night but awfully wobbly today. Once I had it out close enough to the Auk, I had Jeb get out, walk over and plug in the winch cable so I could start refueling.

Damn rear RCS tank promptly fell off.

So far, I'm not particularly liking KAS.

Tested a prototype for my DUN-B "Curitunity" rover (hybrid Spirit/Opportunity MER-A/B rover and Curiosit MSL.) First landing test ended in the skycrane flipping end over end when I tried to land...Dammit, KAS! Pics when I get on my PC.

Reached Eve for the first time, dropping an unmanned lander on it with some science to transmit back. I reckon I won't be able to recover anything from Eve during this iteration of the game, as I'm still fairly new.

well, i've been listening to the martian audio book. loving every minute of it, so I built what I think the Martian Ascent Vehicle (MAV) would look like in ksp (sole job is to get from the surface to the orbiting mothership). And now i'm thinking of trying to build the Martian decent vehicle (MDV).

Shame you can't build structures in this game, that would be awesome.
I started experimenting with electric propulsion for my spacecraft, and a probe I launched to Jool has me toying with electric-only designs for manned missions.

I decided it was time to set my sights a bit further out than Duna, and assembled Dres Explorer I:

I manually docked this puppy together, and could not be happier with the alignments I got. If this can get back from Dres I think I can tackle Jool.

Had to revert 70 ingame days due to a time warp induced SOI change mishap.

Duna mapping and scanning is underway, ground probe will land shortly, manned ship is 14 days behind. Three anomalies detected, landing sites for both available vessels will have to be picked carefully.

Mapping satellite seems to have enough fuel to get to Ike - but Duna's poles are not covered yet and I have to carefully experiment if I can alter the satellite's orbit and still reach Ike.

An Eve window is getting closer.

I finally made my first docking in kerbin orbit.

And due to a failure which brought me in the need of a quickload, i also had to dock again.

Finished my Saturn V rocket replica and did an Apollo Mission with it

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Ship Details

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69862-Saturn-V-Rocket-Apollo-11-Replica

I sent this babe to Eve today,I was scaring it wouldnt fly but,It seems planes fly better on eve than kerbin. just slightly slow.

How I sent;
That clipped-in landing gear looks like a band-aid trying to tape the wings together

I know its not too impresive, but yesterday i reached Eve with a probe for first time, i hurried up and it splashed on a huge ocean at night

I got some science but not as much as i have suposed, i will have to wait to be able to land and return a kerbal from it i supose

I have been playing with Real Solar System mod and successful rendezvous. Both capsules returned safely to Kerbin later:

<iframe class="imgur-album" width="100%" height="550" frameborder="0" src="http://imgur.com/a/sVp1U/embed"></iframe>

Today, I put three of these bad boys into semi-polar orbits (one in a 90Ã‚Â° orbit and one 15Ã‚Â° to either side). They are now mapping the surface of Kerbin, and I'm supervising it all from my station.

My Minmus base.

Still working on it though.
After debugging my new mods loadout I'm on my way to wherever 4500Dv will take me.

Yeah. "Landing"

(http://imgur.com/a/kZzYT)

But I made It back.

Edited February 17, 2014 by likke_A_boss

Sure

Two things:

First off, if you set a limit to the servos you won't have to worry about making the wings level when extended.

Second, what mod gives the lights? I'm still trying to figure that out.

Two things:

First off, if you set a limit to the servos you won't have to worry about making the wings level when extended.

Second, what mod gives the lights? I'm still trying to figure that out.

aviation lights

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/16925
And another hour of driving to keep up with wooks.

i will have to wait to be able to land and return a kerbal from it i supose

Trust me, returning from Eve is IMPOSSIBLE, unless you build a huge rocket.
I hit the Mun with a probe.....going 30,000 m/s......
